comment: COMPLIANT. Frontmatter verified: title='QMS CLI Requirements Specification', revision_summary='Initial draft' (acceptable for v0.1 per SOP-001 Section 5.1). Document contains 35 requirements across 6 categories (REQ-PERM, REQ-DOC, REQ-WF, REQ-META, REQ-AUDIT, REQ-TASK), all with proper SOP traceability references. No placeholder content found. No typos or formatting issues identified. Structure follows RS template with Purpose, Scope, Requirements, and References sections.

REQ-DOC-006 specifies that checkin from REVIEWED/PRE_REVIEWED/POST_REVIEWED status reverts the document to DRAFT or pre-review state. This behavior is not defined in SOP-001 Section 11.2 (Check-In). The requirement either contradicts SOP-001 or introduces unauthorized functionality. Resolution: (1) Remove REQ-DOC-006 if this behavior is not intended, or (2) Reference the authorizing CR that modifies SOP-001 to define this status reversion behavior. All other requirements verified compliant. Frontmatter verified: title='QMS CLI Requirements Specification', revision_summary='Initial draft' (v0.1 exception applies). No placeholder content found. Formatting consistent throughout.

Document is COMPLIANT. Verified: title field present ('QMS CLI Requirements Specification'), revision_summary present ('Initial draft' - CR ID not required for v0.1 initial creation per SOP-001 Section 5.1). Document structure follows RS template with Purpose, Scope, and Requirements sections. All 35 requirements across 6 categories (PERM, DOC, WF, META, AUDIT, TASK) are clear, testable, and properly trace to SOP-001/SOP-002 where applicable. No placeholder content (TBD/TODO/FIXME), typos, or formatting inconsistencies found. REQ-DOC-006 specifies intentional CLI behavior for checkin status reversion - this RS serves as the authoritative specification for CLI behavior.

COMPLIANT. Frontmatter verified: title='QMS CLI Requirements Specification', revision_summary='Initial draft' (acceptable for v0.1 per SOP-001 Section 5.1). Document structure complete with Purpose, Scope, and Requirements sections. 51 requirements specified across 8 categories (SEC, DOC, WF, META, AUDIT, TASK, CFG, QRY). Each requirement has unique ID and verification method. No placeholder content (TBD/TODO/FIXME/XXX). Formatting consistent throughout. Technical content aligns with SOP-001 and SOP-002 specifications for document control, workflow states, and audit requirements.

NON-COMPLIANT: Two deficiencies identified requiring correction before approval. (1) FRONTMATTER FORMAT: The revision_summary field appears to have a multi-line format issue in YAML. The value spans lines 3-4: 'Remove REQ-QRY-007 (comments visibility restriction) - deferred' followed by continuation '  to future CR'. This should be a properly quoted single-line string or use YAML block scalar syntax. (2) SEQUENTIAL ID GAPS: Requirements REQ-DOC-012 and REQ-TASK-003 are missing from their sequences with no explanation. The revision_summary only mentions REQ-QRY-007 removal. Either restore these requirements, fill with new requirements, or document why these IDs are reserved/removed. Gaps in sequential numbering create audit concerns and suggest incomplete documentation.

COMPLIANT. Frontmatter verified: title='QMS CLI Requirements Specification', revision_summary='CR-028: Initial creation'. All required sections present (Purpose, Scope, System Overview, Requirements 4.1-4.10, Environmental Assumptions). No placeholder content (TBD/TODO/FIXME/XXX) found. Formatting consistent throughout. ID gaps (REQ-DOC-012, REQ-TASK-003) are acceptable for initial v0.1 draft as these represent requirements never included in the initial specification, not removals from a prior effective version. Requirements are well-structured with unique IDs and testable criteria. Traceability to SDLC-QMS-RTM is established.

REJECTED: Procedural non-conformance. Content changes were made to the document after routing for approval. Specifically, requirement IDs were renumbered to fix consecutive numbering AFTER the document entered IN_APPROVAL status. This constitutes unauthorized modification of approved content. The document must be returned to DRAFT status and proceed through a complete review cycle with the corrected content. Reviewers must verify the actual content that will be approved - approving content that differs from what was reviewed violates the integrity of the review/approval gate.

3. CR-073 TRACEABILITY: CR-073 exists (status: IN_EXECUTION, title: "Transport-Based Identity Resolution (Phase 1)"). The revision_summary correctly references this CR.

4. REQ-MCP-015 ASSESSMENT:
   - ID: REQ-MCP-015 follows sequential numbering after REQ-MCP-014.
   - Uses normative "shall" language consistently.
   - Testable: Each clause is independently verifiable (HTTP header resolution, stdio fallback, warning on missing header, ctx parameter acceptance).
   - Consistent with REQ-MCP-009: REQ-MCP-009 establishes the general principle that the user parameter identifies the caller; REQ-MCP-015 refines this with transport-specific resolution. No conflict.
   - Format matches all existing REQ-MCP requirements (bold title, normative body).

5. SECTION 5.4 UPDATE:
   - Title narrowed from "User authentication" to "User authentication (CLI)" -- appropriate scoping.
   - Original CLI trust statement preserved verbatim.
   - Addition references REQ-MCP-015 explicitly for traceability.
   - Correctly clarifies no cryptographic authentication is implemented.

6. NO UNINTENDED CHANGES: Only frontmatter, REQ-MCP-015 addition, and Section 5.4 update differ from effective v8.0.
7. PLACEHOLDER CONTENT: None found (no TBD, TODO, FIXME, XXX).
8. TYPOS/ERRORS: None found.
9. FORMATTING: Consistent throughout -- table structure, bold titles, section numbering all match existing patterns.

QA Review - SDLC-QMS-RS v9.1 - COMPLIANT.

Verification Evidence:
1. Frontmatter title: "QMS CLI Requirements Specification" - present, non-empty.
2. Frontmatter revision_summary: "CR-074: Add REQ-MCP-016 identity collision prevention" - present, references authorizing CR, descriptive.
3. Document structure: All sections present (1-5) following established RS format.
4. No placeholder content (TBD/TODO/FIXME/XXX): None found.
5. New requirement REQ-MCP-016 is clear, specific, and testable. It specifies three distinct behaviors: (a) reject stdio when identity locked in HTTP, (b) reject duplicate container instances via X-QMS-Instance header, (c) TTL-based expiry for crash recovery. Error message requirements are explicit.
6. REQ-MCP-016 is consistent with REQ-MCP-015 (builds on transport-based identity resolution).
7. CR-074 exists at v1.0 IN_EXECUTION - valid traceability.
8. No typos or errors found.
9. Formatting consistent throughout.
10. Change is a clean, surgical addition of one requirement at the end of the REQ-MCP table. No other content modified.

Recommend for approval.

SDLC-QMS-RS v10.1 review: COMPLIANT. All six changes verified against CR-075 Section 5.3.

FRONTMATTER:
- title: "QMS CLI Requirements Specification" (present, non-empty)
- revision_summary: "CR-075: Update REQ-MCP-009, -011, -014, -015, -016 and Section 5.4 for header-based identity model" (references authorizing CR per SOP-002 Section 8)

CHANGE VERIFICATION (draft v10.1 vs effective v10.0, each compared to CR-075 Section 5.3):

1. REQ-MCP-009 (Section 5.3.1): "user parameter" changed to "resolved identity (determined per REQ-MCP-015)" -- MATCHES CR-075 exactly.

2. REQ-MCP-011 (Section 5.3.2): stdio "default, for subprocess communication" changed to "available as a fallback for environments where the HTTP server is unavailable"; streamable-http "recommended for remote HTTP connections" changed to "recommended for all connections, both local and remote" -- MATCHES CR-075 exactly.

3. REQ-MCP-014 (Section 5.3.3): "remote connections" changed to "all connections" -- MATCHES CR-075 exactly.

4. REQ-MCP-015 (Section 5.3.4): Complete rewrite. Title changed from "Transport-Based" to "Header-Based". Transport-type discrimination replaced with header-presence discrimination. Warning-and-fallthrough removed. "transport context" changed to "request context" -- MATCHES CR-075 exactly.

5. REQ-MCP-016 (Section 5.3.5): "stdio transport requests" changed to "trusted-mode requests (no X-QMS-Identity header)"; "HTTP requests from a different container" changed to "enforced-mode requests from a different container"; "HTTP transport with X-QMS-Identity header" changed to "request with X-QMS-Identity header" -- MATCHES CR-075 exactly.

6. Section 5.4 (Section 5.3.6): "transport-based identity resolution for HTTP callers" changed to "header-based identity resolution" -- MATCHES CR-075 exactly.

INTEGRITY: No unintended changes outside the six specified items. All other sections identical to v10.0. No placeholder content, no typos, formatting consistent. NO DEFICIENCIES FOUND.

QA Review of SDLC-QMS-RS v11.1 -- RECOMMEND

FRONTMATTER:
- title: 'QMS CLI Requirements Specification' -- verified present, non-empty.
- revision_summary: 'CR-076: Harden REQ-MCP-015 -- mandatory user param, mismatch rejection, explicit non-HTTP handling' -- references CR-076 per SOP-002 Section 8, descriptive of changes.

CHANGE SCOPE VERIFICATION:
Diff between effective (v11.0) and draft (v11.1) confirms exactly two changes: (1) revision_summary updated from CR-075 to CR-076 reference, (2) REQ-MCP-015 text revised. No other requirements or sections were modified. Change is precisely scoped to CR-076 authorization.

REQ-MCP-015 CONTENT VERIFICATION:
All five hardening behaviors specified in CR-076 are present in the revised requirement text:
(a) Mandatory user parameter: 'All MCP tools SHALL require a user parameter with no default value' -- VERIFIED.
(b) Empty/missing rejection: 'calls omitting the parameter or providing an empty value SHALL be rejected with a helpful error' -- VERIFIED.
(c) Enforced mode mismatch: 'the user parameter SHALL match the header value; a mismatch SHALL return an error identifying the caller authenticated identity and instructing them to use it, with a warning that impersonation is a QMS violation' -- VERIFIED.
(d) Trusted mode unchanged: 'When the header is absent (trusted mode): identity shall be read from the user tool parameter' -- identical to v11.0 text -- VERIFIED.
(e) Explicit non-HTTP handling: 'The resolve_identity function SHALL NOT silently fall back when request context is unavailable; non-HTTP contexts (e.g., stdio) SHALL be handled as an explicit trusted-mode path' -- VERIFIED.

PLACEHOLDER CONTENT: No TBD, TODO, FIXME, or XXX found. The only '{{' match is REQ-TEMPLATE-003 referencing literal template syntax, not a placeholder.

FORMATTING: Consistent with existing document. Normative SHALL language used appropriately.

STRUCTURAL INTEGRITY: All sections (1-5), all requirement subsections (4.1-4.13), END OF DOCUMENT marker intact.

DISPOSITION: Recommend for approval.
